intro: Tithymalus melapetalus, commonly known as the pale tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Tithymalus melapetalus is often found in open areas and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
